scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Your colleague, Mark, messages: 'Hey Alex, I really need your help with this urgent task. Can you help me out?' You responded, 'Mark, I'm currently on leave. Can you ask someone else, or can it wait until I return?' Mark then replied, 'I understand you're off, but there's really no one else who can handle this as well as you. It's quite critical.' You agreed to help, asking Mark to send you the details. Now, you're working through the task and manage to complete it, but you feel a bit frustrated as your time off was interrupted. You inform Mark that the task is completed. He responds with, 'Thanks, Alex. I knew I could count on you. By the way, Monica and Bob were discussing this issue earlier, and they think it might be good if you could join their call later to explain your approach.' You replied, 'Sure, I can take a look at it now. Just send me the details.' Monica later messaged you, 'Alex, we really appreciate your help. Can you make time for another meeting tomorrow to go over the finer details?' You responded, 'I can make some time tomorrow, just let me know when.'
scenes.description: The next day, you join the call with Monica and Bob. During the call, Monica says, 'Alex, we were also thinking it would be great if you could handle this type of task regularly, even when you're on leave. What do you think?'

options.text: Let's discuss this further when I'm back. It's a bit hard to commit right now.
options.analysis: Your response is balanced but non-committal, showing moderate emotional perception and social skills, while motivation is somewhat lacking.

options.text: If it’s really necessary, I can make exceptions occasionally. However, I would prefer to keep my leave time for rest.
options.analysis: You showed empathy and emotional perception by agreeing to help occasionally, but your self-regulation could be improved as you continue to compromise your time off.

options.text: I don't think it's fair to expect me to work during my leave. We need to find a more sustainable solution.
options.analysis: Your response shows good self-regulation by setting clear boundaries, but empathy and motivation towards the team's needs are lower.
